//Description for the About us and general sections of the app The Pink Palace Museum is one of the largest facilities of its kind in the Southeast. Explore the cultural and natural history of the Mid-South through exciting exhibits, dioramas, and audio-visuals. Trace Memphis' development from the time of Spanish explorers through the Civil War and the yellow fever epidemics. Learn from the award-winning medical exhibit how health care grew to be Memphis' largest industry. See how dinosaurs and fossils dramatically chronicle our ever-changing planet. The Museum also hosts a number of touring exhibits to see and experience throughout the year. Each year hundreds of thousands of people visit the Memphis Pink Palace Museum. Mansion Coloring Page See the Pink Palace Museum featured as part of a "kid-friendly" weekend in Memphis! Prices: 
						Group pricing available. 
						Call 901.636.2362

Exhibits only 
				Members - Free 
				$9.00-CHILD (3-12) 
				$12.25-SENIOR (60+) 
				$12.75-ADULT (13-59) 
				Children 2 and under - FREE

Admission to the Museum is free Tuesdays from 1pm to close. 

CTI 3D Giant Theater and Planetarium shows are not included.
//This section is for the description and titles, of the Events and Exhibits earlyscience OCTOBER 24, 31 
10am & 12 noon 

Early Science Learners is a new event for you and your little ones! Spark your child's love for learning at an early age. This program is for scientists 2-5 years old. This month's topic is owls. Every session includes: A chance to interact with a museum artifact A story read aloud A fun activity to get the wiggles out A craft related to the topic of the month Member Price is $5 per participant Non-Member Price is $6 per participant All children must be chaperoned! Call 901.636.2362 for tickets starting October 2. We are offering this same program each week throughout October. Stay tuned for new programs and new topics in the future! harrypotter Harry Potter movies on our Giant Screen! 
It's off to Hogwarts! Grab your broom, Thestral, Hippogriff or hop in your flying Ford Anglia so you don't miss eight weeks of the original Harry Potter series, weekends in September and October. Relive the magic like never before, see them all on our Giant Screen! October 21 & 22: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows part 1 October 28 & 29: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows part 2 Special Harry Potter Scavenger Hunt and Movie combo Saturday, October 28! You won't believe how many of Harry's things ended up here at the Pink Palace after his Hogwarts days, over 30 items have been hidden in our collection this whole time! santalanding Santa Lands at 9am Saturday, November 18 

Santa's landing and other lawn activities are free to the public, but an admission ticket is required for the Enchanted Forest. Santa arrives by helicopter to open the Enchanted Forest Festival of Trees, a fundraiser for Le Bonheur Children’s Hospital! With his epic dash around the globe a mere month away, Santa Claus needs to let his eight tiny reindeer get their rest! While you wait for Santa, have fun with Rocky Redbird and the Art Project! Metro Eats from the Pink Palace will be on hand, selling coffee, hot chocolate and more. Plus Le Bonheur has donut holes for the kids. Swooping in from the North Pole, Santa’s chopper will land on the lawn of the Pink Palace Mansion, where the young and young-at-heart will greet the jolly old elf with cheers of joy! Once the chopper rotors stop spinning, join in as Santa and the Memphis Second Line Jazz Band lead a parade inside the Pink Palace Museum, officially opening the Enchanted Forest Festival of Trees. Stop at Pink Palace box office to get tickets, then visit Santa in the Enchanted Forest —where even more magic awaits!mething here beer Friday, January 12, 2018 
6:00-9:30 pm 
Tickets will go on sale mid-October. 
Prices: 
Designated Driver: $35 
Member Ticket: $50 
Non-Member Ticket: $55 
Member VIP Ticket: $60 
Non-Member VIP Ticket: $65 

It’s the 5th Annual Science of Beer! Every guest will feel like a VIP as we celebrate our 5-year Anniversary with an exclusive beer experience. 
Eat! The best local restaurants will be here to serve you the tastiest beer food this side of the Mississippi! Drink! Excite your taste buds with beer samples from local professional and home brewers. Sample beers from your favorite breweries across the South. Learn! Talk shop with brewers while you sample their wares then head to one of our lectures to perfect your knowledge on all things beer. Returning Favorites: Pretzel necklaces Beer goggle sports Giant Jenga Beer-themed Crafts Professor-lead Experiments (sponsored by: Diversified Trust) Exclusive New Additions: Mini Beer Memorabilia Museum Scavenger Hunt Prize Pull Silent Auction More beer, more food, more fun to be announced soon! enchantedforest The Enchanted Forest 
Open November 18 - December 31, 2017 
Admission to the Enchanted Forest does not include regular Museum admission. 
Ticket prices: 
Adults: $6 
Children/Seniors: $5 
The Enchanted Forest The elves, penguins, bears and charming holiday characters in The Enchanted Forest Festival of Trees are getting ready for you and your whole family this holiday season. This is a 65-year-old Memphis tradition. The Enchanted Forest is a magical experience full of delightful animated characters. Elves are busy making toys while penguins, bears and mice play in the snow. A model train winds its way around a miniature snow-covered village while the nearby Gingerbread Village smells delightful! Thousands of twinkling lights shine from dozens of beautifully-decorated trees lining the mezzanine. Area businesses, churches and other volunteers have decorated the trees, which are sponsored by local corporations and individuals, and you’re sure to find a favorite. Festival of Trees Beautiful trees decorated by professional designers, individuals and local organizations sparkle on the mezzanine. Gingerbread Village A snow-covered village of scrumptious creations awaits you! From cozy cottages to majestic mansions, all are designed by local chefs, businesses, individuals and groups. Model Train and Christmas Village A miniature train twists and turns throughout a snow-covered village, inspiring the imagination of children and adults alike. Pictures with Santa November 18 – December 24 Photo packages: $10 – $60 Photos courtesy of J&B Childress Portrait Art www.jandbchildress.com Enchanted Forest Fridays Dec. 1, 8, 15 & 22 9am to 9pm The Enchanted Forest is even more magical at night! Visit when the sun goes down and see how the trees sparkle and shine!hing here cultural The First Americans, butcher marks on a mastodon bone tell of a successful Paleolithic hunt. An extraordinary collection of finely crafted tools and Native American pottery are remnants of a complex civilization on the Mississippi. Mystical hunchback figures, grim disembodied human heads, and whimsical animal effigies, all carefully buried with the dead, reflect the spiritual beliefs of this mysterious culture. The History of Memphis, 1800-1900 tells the story of Memphis from its birth as a frontier river town to its emergence as a vital Victorian Era city. Slavery and emancipation, disease and medicine, privilege and persecution are all brought to life through objects of both everyday life and extraordinary events. See Memphis housing from a reconstructed frontier cabin to an opulent Victorian music room An horrific battle diorama forms the centerpiece of the Civil War gallery. Thomas Harwell’s “mummy casket,” in its darkened alcove, represents an archeological mystery solved, while a mail coach, private buggy and public omnibus evoke the era of horse-drawn transportation. future Exhibits will be updated and highly interactive. The themes are: Physical Sciences and Geology Life Sciences, including fitness, nutrition, health and wellness Regional and Cultural History Each area can be entered separately or the visitor can move through them in order. Pink Palace Treasures: The Piggly Wiggly Store Clyde Parke Circus Shrunken Head…etc. These items will be moved to a place of honor in the Mansion: The second floor of the Mansion’s East Wing will once again be open to the public after being empty for many years, and will house the Clyde Parke Circus. In the meantime, please enjoy the rest of our cultural and natural history exhibits, as well as our temporary exhibits, CTI 3D Giant Theater, AutoZone Dome at the Sharpe Planetarium, the Bella Caffe, and our Museum Stores, all open for your visit. natural The first floor of the museum describes the natural history of the Mid-south. This area, within a 200 mile area radius of Memphis, encompasses several major environments including the channels and oxbow lakes of the Mississippi River and its tributaries, their associated floodplains; the sand hills of western Tennessee and northern Mississippi, and the nearby highlands of the Ouachita and Ozark Mountains in Arkansas and the Highland Rim of Central Tennessee. The exhibits open with “Adaptations”, a large collection of skulls and skeletons of all types of animals. The display explains how the placement of teeth, horns and antlers, and eyes as well as body shapes show how animals have evolved to adapt to their environment.
